data.title: Could have been an enlightenment
data.text: I stopped by because I wanted to learn more about Sufism, but the gent who served me just pointed at some pamphlets.  Coffee was OK, but higher priced than the local chains, and I was alone in the shop.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: I had picked this place to have a meeting over coffee.  It turned out my friend had an upset tummy and she wasn't prepared to eat or drink anything.  So I went up to order myself a cup of coffee and I have never been more hassled at a cafe for just ordering one cup of coffee.  The worst owner/host I have come across in my life!

data.title: Faultless
data.text: The most perfect cup of drip coffee I've ever had - zero acidity, zero bitterness, piping hot and utterly smooth.  If you like the smell of coffee but don't like the taste, you need to try a cup at Sufi - it could change everything for you.  And, for coffee drinkers, it puts even the good coffee you normally drink to shame and erases any excuse baristas have for the acidic, weak, tepid or bitter sludge they frequently have the nerve to serve you.

data.title: A little gem!
data.text: Totally buried in the midst of shops and streets, almost hidden, yet a persistent graciousness and old-world charm. Coffee hand processed, served in a shaded alcove away from the nearby bustle. You can relax here!

data.title: Life Changing Coffee Shop Philosopher
data.text:
"Money and fun are not your aim, evolution should be your aim."  

I walked into Sufi expecting a nice cuppa Joe.  I walked out with a more sensible taste in coffee and a slightly changed life philosophy.

The owner talked me down from putting milk and honey in my coffee.  "I hope you're not going to spoil that with sugar and honey" he said after making a Sufi blend pour over.

So he proceeded to tell me that sugar was bad for society.  His point was well made and heeded.  So I tried it without, and enjoyed the black coffee, enzymes intact.  For 15 years I've indulged in honey laden coffee.  

Then I tried the Kona blend which was also great.  

So go chill and enjoy some real coffee when you're in Sili Valley, at Sufi.  Great place, great coffee.  ...and wisdom.

data.title: very nice eclectic cafe
data.text:
Unique coffee, ambience and owner :)

Love the coffee and the vibe of this place - nice indoor space and cute outdoor seating as well - quite zen. Owner can seem a bit intimidating at first blush but its all good! Take your time and savor their "original recipe coffee" - always fresh.

data.title: One of a kind coffee shop
data.text: The Sufi Coffee Shop is unique: it is one of a kind. The coffee is always fresh (roasted on site in small batches), then ground and poured individually for each customer -- and the conversation is never dull. Honesty abounds here. It's possible that the first encounter with the owner may not be filled with socially acceptable, superficial friendliness, but a more forthright person you will not find, and if you are lucky, you will walk away from the coffee shop with new insight into yourself and your life. People return to the place, even if the first encounter took them by surprise. They are drawn by something piercingly honest and fresh. That, in addition to the rich array of coffee choices and tasty paninis and home-made soups, is enough to entice a person to return again and again to this unique treasure in Mt. View.

data.title: Sufi Coffee shop - My sanctuary
data.text: It's my sanctuary, my Zen, never want to leave, but work across the street beckons (sigh). I meet here on a regular basis for lunch (awesome chicken teriyaki panini) with a former coworker that drives in all the way from Campbell so she can get her fix, as well as current coworkers. The owners are so nice. Their homemade soup is awesome, choc full of veggies.Your drip coffee is made fresh on the spot so If you are in a hurry, don't go here this place is to relax and take a moment to reflect. Always feel refreshed and ready to tackle the world after my visits.

data.title: Out of this world
data.text:
The Sufi Coffee Shop is a rare find. You won’t taste a better cup of coffee anywhere, and the experience is simply out of this world. The proprietor roasts 2–3 small batches of coffee a week, so it’s always fresh. He waits patiently while you consider the possibilities, then he grinds the beans you request for an individually dripped cup of coffee that you can savor inside or in the delightful outdoor patio. 

Another house specialty is the Turkish coffee, or you might enjoy one of the many delicious espresso drinks and smoothies on the menu. If you’re hungry for more, you can take your pick of pastries, paninis, and homemade soup.

Over the past 11 years, this little gem has enriched the local Mountain View community. It may not be quite what you expect when you cross the transom but if you are looking for a unique haven from the daily grind, you might find it’s just what you need.

data.title: Gotta Love the Sufi Coffee Guy!
data.text:
Yes! If you want the perfect uncomfortable coffee experience for your friends just let them order a vanilla half caf latte w/skinny syrup and 2 add shots, extra foam. Then watch them get glared down to a wimper. Coffee. or. Turkish coffee. I'm not even sure if this place has milk. This is a serious coffee experience.  Books. There are books here. I'm too scared to whip out my ipad. 
I Love This Place!!! You must go.

data.title: coffee in the garden
data.text: At this small coffee shop you can have a private bench in a small garden to relax and enjoy your coffee or a snack. The owner seems to always be there. In the store there are books of poetry and culture, and the owner has his nose in a book when not dealing with a customer, which sets a mood that is rather peaceful and serious...no brightly happy disco music here so you can fill your space with your own happiness rather than having it infused from electronic stimuli.

data.title: A place that i would like to go everyday.
data.text: Great fresh drip coffee. Excellent soup and paninis. This place really feels like a human place with no corporate culture.

data.title: Uncommon place
data.text:
Everything at the Sufi coffee shop is wonderful. They roast their own coffee and drip your coffee to order. The service and food is excellent.
It is not like a typical coffee shop, it has its special character.

data.title: Best coffee in the Bay Area, with a wonderful little back patio that's like an arbor.  Other coffee drinks, teas, etc...
data.text: Best coffee in the Bay Area, with a wonderful little back patio that's like an arbor.  Other coffee drinks, teas, etc. too, with Wi-Fi and shelves full of books and with Sufi proverbs and other wise sayings posted around the place.  Go there!

data.title: хороший кофе по -турецки
data.text: всегда заходим с женой в субботу выпить у них кофе, приятно, что есть не типичные там латте или американо, а европейские варианты, в турке , по-венски. обслуживание приятное, как если ты пришел в гости к друзьям. и уютное место снаружи
